uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation

Class DatabaseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation.DatabaseHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppDBHandler

    public class DatabaseHandler
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    This class deals with the initial creation of a database which can be used by the applications. It deals with creating and manipulating the User table which is the same format for the Information Aggregator and the Activity Program.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)
        Called when the database is created for the first time. This is where the creation of tables and the initial population of the tables happens.
        Parameters:
        db - The database.

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        Called when the database needs to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to drop tables, add tables, or do anything else it needs to upgrade to the new schema version.

        The SQLite ALTER TABLE documentation can be found here. If you add new columns you can use ALTER TABLE to insert them into a live table. If you rename or remove columns you can use ALTER TABLE to rename the old table, then create the new table and then populate the new table with the contents of the old table.

        This method executes within a transaction. If an exception is thrown, all changes will automatically be rolled back.

        Parameters:
        db - The database.
        oldVersion - The old database version.
        newVersion - The new database version.

      • createTable

        public void createTable(java.lang.String query)
        Creates a table by executing the given query.
        Parameters:
        query - query containing code to create a table

      • checkTableExists

        public boolean checkTableExists(java.lang.String tableName)

      • getTableNames

        public java.util.List getTableNames()

      • insertUser

        public void insertUser(User user)
        Inserts a new user into the database. This is done by getting each of the User object models properties and putting them into the correct table in the database. (Used for Registration of a new user on the application)
        Parameters:
        user - User to insert to the database User table.

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser(java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Checks a user exists on the database by checking the email and password given against the users in the database. This is done by retrieving each user from the database in the form of a list and checking the email and password of each until a match is found. (Used to check user credentials when logging into the application)
        Parameters:
        password - user password to check
        email - user email to check
        Returns:
        true if user exists, false otherwise.

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String email)
        Retrieves a user from the database based on their ID.
        Parameters:
        email - email of the user to retrieve.
        Returns:
        a User object, containing the information of the retrieved user.

      • getAllUsers

        public java.util.List<User> getAllUsers()
        Retrieves all the users from the User table in the database
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of type User with all the users from the database

      • setDatabaseName

        public void setDatabaseName(java.lang.String dbname)
        Changes the name of the Database to a given name
        Parameters:
        dbname - new name to set the database to.

      • getEvent

        public Event getEvent(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves a single Event from the database based on its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - email of the user to retrieve.
        Returns:
        a Event object, containing the information of the retrieved event.

      • getAllEvents

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getAllEvents()
        Retrieves the whole of the Event table from the database. Places each attribute of the table is retrieve to make an Event object which is added to the Event object ArrayList
        Returns:
        a list of Event objects.

      • getUserEvents

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUserEvents()
        Retrieves the whole of the UserEvents table from the database. Places each attribute of the table in a string where each attribute is separated by a hashtag. Used for debugging and checking the contents of the table.
        Returns:
        a list of Strings, where each string represents a row in the table with each attribute separated by a hashtag.

      • insertEvent

        public void insertEvent(java.lang.String id,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String desc,
                        java.lang.String date,
                        java.lang.String time)
        Inserts an new entry into the Event table of the database using the attributes given.
        Parameters:
        id - id of event
        name - name of event
        desc - description of event
        date - date of the event
        time - time of the event

      • insertEventSubscription

        public void insertEventSubscription(java.lang.String useremail,
                                    java.lang.String eventid)
        Inserts an new entry into the UserEvents table of the database using the attributes given.
        Parameters:
        useremail - email of the user that is subscribing to the event
        eventid - id of event user is subscribing to

      • deleteEventSubscription

        public void deleteEventSubscription(java.lang.String userEmail,
                                    java.lang.String eventid)
        Deletes a user event subscription entry from the database UserEvents table
        Parameters:
        userEmail - user email for which to delete the subscription for
        eventid - id of the event which is to be unsubscribed/remove from table

      • deleteUserEventSub

        public void deleteUserEventSub(java.lang.String userEmail)
        Remove all users subscriptions from UserEvents table
        Parameters:
        userEmail - user email for which to delete the subscriptions for
